title: Softball: Mullen does it all in debut as Livingston blanks No. 16 Cedar Grove
body: SPICON Hackettstown vs. Jefferson in Thursday's high school softball match up in Oak Ridge.  Jefferson rolled, 9-1.  04/28/2016 (Steve Hockstein | For NJ Advance Media)Sophomore Caitlin Mullen made her first varsity game one she won’t soon forget pitched a two-hit shutout, striking out 11 and walking three, she also reached base four times to lead Livingston to a 12-0, six-inning victory over Cedar Grove, No. 16 in the NJ.com Top 20, in Cedar Grove.Mullen went 1-for-1 with three walks for Livingston (1-0), which immediately struck for three runs in the top of the first inning. Deja Robinson was 1-for-1 with two walks, a hit-by-pitch, three RBI and two runs. Katie Harrell and Guilia Wilson scored three runs with two stolen bases apiece, Hailey Reuter walked twice with two runs and a stolen base, and Nathalia Dilanni went 2-for-5 with a run and a RBI.Katie Peterson was 1-for-2 with a walk for Cedar Grove.Note to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
